= Context =

<blockquote>A context is a logically separated fragment of an RDF repository. Contexts are used internally to group together data, e.g. a single context may identify all data that has been added by a provider at a given point in time.</blockquote>

The following contexts are available:

{{#widget: TableResult |
query = '
SELECT ?Context ?Type ?Source ?Date ?isEditable 
WHERE {
  ?Context rdf:type ?? .
  OPTIONAL { ?Context rdfs:label ?Type } 
  OPTIONAL { ?Context :contextSrc ?Source }
  OPTIONAL { ?Context dc:date ?Date }
  OPTIONAL { ?Context :editable ?isEditable } 
}'
}}

Please click on a context to obtain detailed information on the respective context.
